TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed WebApplicationLevel extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the path level of a Web-application configuration file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.WebApplicationLevel> class provides three levels that are used to distinguish where a configuration file is in relation to the root level of an ASP.NET Web application. The three path-level types are AboveApplication, AtApplication, and BelowApplication.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Configuration.WebApplicationLevel AboveApplication = int32(10)

Docs.summary: Specifies that the configuration file is in a global directory in relation to the current ASP.NET Web application.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Configuration.WebApplicationLevel AtApplication = int32(20)

Docs.summary: Specifies that the configuration file is in the root directory of the current ASP.NET Web application.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Configuration.WebApplicationLevel BelowApplication = int32(30)

Docs.summary: Specifies that the configuration file is in a sub-directory of the current ASP.NET Web application.
